Juan, Glenn.
I think you are actually in two different pages.
Juan is talk=
ing about the REST certificate, and the actual quality of the service from =
the server point of view. 
Glenn is talking, as Juan correctly notes, about=
 the quality of the system. 
Both may be right. 
The only thing I disagree =
is with Juan's notion of service quality. To me, for the service to be grea=
t, it has to assure the correct use and handle bad use, as clients are on t=
he wild out there. Working great only with nice behaving clients and blamin=
g bad clients does not mean good quality for me. But that said, it is my PO=
V.

William.
